identified_line.line: 2. Arm E: Patients with cutaneous melanoma who may be naïve to all prior therapy for advanced or metastatic disease. identified_line.line: 1. Have a history of another active malignancy (a second cancer) within the previous 2 years except for localized cancers that are not related to the current cancer being treated, are considered cured, and, in the opinion of the Investigator, presents a low risk of recurrence. These exceptions include, but are not limited to, basal or squamous cell skin cancer, superficial bladder cancer, or carcinoma in situ of the prostate, cervix, or breast;
